name: Thai Coconut Custard Dessert (Khanom Tuay Recipe)
description: This Thai coconut custard dessert is easy to make and always a hit with the family. This recipe yields 20 khanom tuay, ideal for serving a family of 4.

recipeInstructions.text: Warm your ceramic bowls in a steamer over medium heat for 10 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Warm your ceramic bowls in a steamer over medium heat for 10 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Use your hand to mix coconut sugar, water, and pandan leaves (if using) in a glass bowl until the sugar dissolves.
recipeInstructions.name: Use your hand to mix coconut sugar, water, and pandan leaves (if using) in a glass bowl until the sugar dissolves.

recipeInstructions.text: Knead coconut milk into the sugar mixture until well combined.
recipeInstructions.name: Knead coconut milk into the sugar mixture until well combined.

recipeInstructions.text: In another bowl, blend tapioca and rice flour together. Slowly whisk in the coconut sugar liquid.
recipeInstructions.name: In another bowl, blend tapioca and rice flour together. Slowly whisk in the coconut sugar liquid.

recipeInstructions.text: Strain the combined mixture to remove any lumps.
recipeInstructions.name: Strain the combined mixture to remove any lumps.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour just over a tablespoon of this mixture into each bowl. Steam for 10 minutes, then get started on the next layer.
recipeInstructions.name: Pour just over a tablespoon of this mixture into each bowl. Steam for 10 minutes, then get started on the next layer.

recipeInstructions.text: In a new large bowl, mix rice flour with salt.
recipeInstructions.name: In a new large bowl, mix rice flour with salt.

recipeInstructions.text: Slowly add water and coconut milk to the flour, whisking as you go.
recipeInstructions.name: Slowly add water and coconut milk to the flour, whisking as you go.

recipeInstructions.text: Strain the coconut milk mixture to ensure it’s smooth.

recipeInstructions.text: Once the bottom layer is firm, carefully spoon the white layer mixture on top until it reaches just below the blue border. Steam for 5–10 minutes until firm. Some people like it better when the coconut oil separates, you can do this by steaming for longer. Allow the dessert to cool before serving.
